title: babo
author: babo
content: this is official roster of speakers cool

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Could you share some more info about it? I am interested in this.

comments.author: john_egbert
comments.body: I already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Quote from: apogio on March 06, 2025, 10:26:10 AMCould you share some more info about it? I am interested in this. You might want to hear Michael Saylor's interview about it, and the US could start investing a million as he hinted, but we will have to see.https://x.com/saylor/status/1897398035661119783And it will led by David Sacks, President Trump's AI and crypto czar. And it will start at :30 p.m. to 5 p.m. ET on Friday, March 7.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: I hope Cathie Wood and Vitalik will be present there. Both bullish if they say something and going to lift up Bitcoin first and then Vitalik's ETH.  Quote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Let's see if he's more effective than Trump recently. Because last time, it was Elon that's making these pumps through their words. But maybe this time, aside from his continuous purchase maybe his words of encouragement will make sense to the people that are just watching out the market.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: This is a good development. I just hope that this summit touches on all issues affecting the crypto industry, not just regulations, but also good innovations and policies to make cryptocurrencies of all kinds attractive to everyone, including private individuals, small and large businesses, traders, investors, governments, and corporate bodies. This is a revolution, and I can't wait to see more updates from the summit and how it will affect Bitcoin and altcoins in the long run.Quote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Op didn't add any link to his post, when exactly is the submit? Bitcoin is currently trading at 91k, could this be the reason for the sudden price increase?

comments.author: Cryptohygenic
comments.body: Quote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Does coins with good potentials ever do fake pumps? Where I can tell a coin is pumped fake is a set of phishing when the coin is aided to scam it holders.So I hope you don't refer this fake pump to bitcoin which has proven it realistic potential values?

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Was that not why the market even make it to cross $90,000 and before we could know it, everything rallied to $91,000 and from there, we may go more bullish till after the Congress again, everyone investing on short term should take care, extra caution because anything can suddenly emerge at the cause of these, we hope every decision and deliberation made should be in favour of the increase in bitcoin adoption rate and acceptance globally, maybe we could even acheive having the last all time high sooner than later.

comments.author: Felicity_Tide
comments.body: Quote from: Zoomic on March 06, 2025, 11:30:50 AMQuote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Op didn't add any link to his post, when exactly is the submit? Bitcoin is currently trading at 91k, could this be the reason for the sudden price increase?The summit is actually next week Friday at the Whitehouse.I strongly believe that the purpose of the summit shouldn't be anything outside the Bitcoin reserve that trump had proposed initially. They probably want to have some discussions on how to make it happened, and I also saw something like how to handle alts as well. I think trump also made mentioned of adding few alts to the reserve, which will also be a good discussion as well, because it seems so many people don't buy that idea.And I don't think the summit has anything to do with Bitcoin's price at this point.All anticipation and focus is now channel to the coming summit.I've received a couple of notifications in the past few days of newly minted usdc already. Can't wait to see how things turns out.

comments.author: death69
comments.body: The concept of a U.S. crypto reserve is cool for several reasons, including the fact that it is novel and the implications it has for issues of control, trust, and the future of currency.Governments ignored crypto as a speculative asset, a bubble, a tool for criminals for years. They suddenly want to hold it next to gold? If that fails to stop you and cause you to consider, nothing will.Who's at the table and who's missing is interesting. Not one Federal Reserve or big bank representative here. Why? Vitalik Buterin is still unconfirmed; is Ethereum being underlined or is there an ideological divide? Where’s BlackRock, the biggest institutional Bitcoin holder?Also, there's the altcoin things. For a reserve, bitcoin makes logic. It is political neutral, distributed, and strong. But XRP, SOL, ADA? Is this about financial diversification, or are these projects closely ties to the administration?Everything changes if the U.S. government considers Bitcoin as a strategic asset. Because what follows? New laws? (This might either help or suffocate the industry.) International response? (Will other nations start their own reserves?) Financial stability concerns? (Imagine a government-owned Bitcoin market maker, a horrible idea.)

comments.author: Reatim
comments.body: Quote from: passwordnow on March 06, 2025, 11:00:49 AMQuote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Let's see if he's more effective than Trump recently. Because last time, it was Elon that's making these pumps through their words. But maybe this time, aside from his continuous purchase maybe his words of encouragement will make sense to the people that are just watching out the market.One could argue that that is because both Elon and Saylor have been crypto enthusiasts for a long time. Meanwhile back then when Trump was last president, he was hating on bitcoin and crypto and saying that it is not a real currency or something like that. Now we have him saying he is a fan of bitcoin alongside other altcoins. In short, Trump is new in the crypto industry and might not have the same deep understanding as Elon Musk and Michael Saylor both have.

comments.author: jstyler
comments.body: what about the fact that Saylor has been consistently buying the dip and that's a huge deal, it shows he's not just talking the talk, he's walking the walk, now let's see if his words of encouragement will have the same effect as his actions, can we expect to see a bigger pump if he announces another round of purchases?

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: Reatim on March 06, 2025, 01:41:23 PMQuote from: passwordnow on March 06, 2025, 11:00:49 AMQuote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Let's see if he's more effective than Trump recently. Because last time, it was Elon that's making these pumps through their words. But maybe this time, aside from his continuous purchase maybe his words of encouragement will make sense to the people that are just watching out the market.One could argue that that is because both Elon and Saylor have been crypto enthusiasts for a long time. Meanwhile back then when Trump was last president, he was hating on bitcoin and crypto and saying that it is not a real currency or something like that. Did he said that before? I can't remember but if he did, it's possible that he studied about it and obviously included it to his campaign rallies and speeches.Quote from: Reatim on March 06, 2025, 01:41:23 PM Now we have him saying he is a fan of bitcoin alongside other altcoins. In short, Trump is new in the crypto industry and might not have the same deep understanding as Elon Musk and Michael Saylor both have.Things changed and escalated too quick for him because he has to do that prior to his presidency. And now that he is in the position, he has to what's necessary for him to have it added to his plans for his administration. But about his thoughts and understanding about Bitcoin, you're right, Elon and Michael has more indepth knowledge about it.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: This is a welcome development and further shows that President Donald Trump is actually making good on his promise of making America the crypto capital of the world. I love the fact that Michael Saylor is in the list because he is like the mouthpiece for bitcoin, his presence in that conference is like a representation for bitcoin and I hope to hear his motivation for what he does with bitcoin and how he will be able to convince others to buy and hold just like he is doing. I am sure this is a positive development for cryptocurrency in general.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: Felicity_Tide on March 06, 2025, 12:04:30 PMQuote from: Zoomic on March 06, 2025, 11:30:50 AMQuote from: john_egbert on March 06, 2025, 10:37:27 AMI already see a small fake pump from what Saylor is going to say, mark my words  Op didn't add any link to his post, when exactly is the submit? Bitcoin is currently trading at 91k, could this be the reason for the sudden price increase?The summit is actually next week Friday at the Whitehouse.I strongly believe that the purpose of the summit shouldn't be anything outside the Bitcoin reserve that trump had proposed initially. They probably want to have some discussions on how to make it happened, and I also saw something like how to handle alts as well. I think trump also made mentioned of adding few alts to the reserve, which will also be a good discussion as well, because it seems so many people don't buy that idea.And I don't think the summit has anything to do with Bitcoin's price at this point.All anticipation and focus is now channel to the coming summit.I've received a couple of notifications in the past few days of newly minted usdc already. Can't wait to see how things turns out.This is a good one.Well, it is still good to know that a government and a world power like US can organise a submit to discuss crypto. Whether this has an indirect impact on bitcoin's price is not my major concern, rather my interest is on the fact that crypto, including Bitcoin has gained some level of relevance and recognition by the government attracting such influential speakers. This is something we never imagined years back would ever happen in the crypto space considering all the attacks back then. However, just as I have said earlier, we just hope that this submit gives room for some favourable policies that will be of benefit to crypto enthusiasts in the US and all over the world. I will be on the lookout for more updates from the submit.

comments.author: moneystery
comments.body: this crypto summit will probably be an important event because it is the first crypto summit held by the white house directly and attended by us officials and big players in the crypto industry. surely their discussion will revolve around the regulation and development of the crypto industry, especially in america... and most likely at this summit trump will state directly about the strategic crypto reserve, and the responses of the big players to it. if the results of this summit are positive enough, then maybe we will be able to see the bitcoin and altcoin markets moving up.

comments.author: NewCryptocasinos
comments.body: That's a really nice lineup of speakers! How can I buy a ticket?

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: If white house is holding a cryptocurrency (bitcoin) submit, it's a good news but what about the adoption. It is the adoption of bitcoin in the Nationwide we are waiting for to hear and not submit upon submit and at the end they will still abandon it and when new government comes they will change policies to affect investors. Op your thread is shallow and needs more flesh. It is only the speakers who have been confirmed to speak that you posted.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: It's a strong lineup for an important summit but what's the point of hosting crypto events in the white house unless Trump's seated as head of the dinner table. For 4 years he's making decisions which can make history so will Trump & Musk attend ?

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Good to see that! But I am not sure if anything positive will come out of it or not. Trump is bringing the industry leads under the same roof for sure, but if some people friendly policies are not being formed as a result of this summit, it doesn't makes sense to us! Trump has shown many different colours till date. I am not sure what colour he is going to show here in this summit. Will wait for more info.
